citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There were 7 weaned pups from 2 litters in an enclosure that had multiple scabs and large areas of flakey skin on their
head, neck and body. The representative stated that it had been observed about 3 days prior to this day and the pups had
been shaved and given baths with Adams medicated shampoo. The puppies also appeared slightly thin, which can be an
indication of inadequate nutrition or parasites; however, the pups were active and eating and curious. A veterinarian had
not been contacted for diagnosis and treatment for these conditions, which is important to prevent any worsening of the
conditions.
A veterinarian must be consulted for proper diagnosis and treatment for these puppies' conditions. Treatment
recommendations by the veterinarian must be followed at all times. The licensee must keep and maintain medical
records, as required, and they must be made available to APHIS officials.
Correction date: June 3, 2024 Note: The dogs were examined by a veterinarian on May 31 and a treatment plan was
developed, and medication was dispensed.
ID# of pups: Poodle DOB: 2/26/2024
Male cream #900217000729549
Male, B&W # 900217000730251
Female, cream 900217000730243
CorgiPoo DOB :3/4/2024
Male cream 900217000730248
Male cream 900217000730241
Female cream 900217000730242
Female Tan & White 900217000730246
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There were 7 weaned pups from 2 litters in an enclosure that had multiple scabs and large areas of flakey skin on their 
head, neck and body. The representative stated that it had been observed about 3 days prior to this day and the pups had 
been shaved and given baths with Adams medicated shampoo. The puppies also appeared slightly thin, which can be an 
indication of inadequate nutrition or parasites; however, the pups were active and eating and curious. A veterinarian had 
not been contacted for diagnosis and treatment for these conditions, which is important to prevent any worsening of the 
conditions.  
A veterinarian must be consulted for proper diagnosis and treatment for these puppies' conditions. Treatment 
recommendations by the veterinarian must be followed at all times. The licensee must keep and maintain medical 
records, as required, and they must be made available to APHIS officials. 
 
Correction date: June 3, 2024 Note: The dogs were examined by a veterinarian on May 31 and a treatment plan was 
developed, and medication was dispensed.
